citeinfo.origin: Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Office of Land Quality
citeinfo.title: COAL_COMBUSTION_WASTE_IMPOUNDMENTS_INSPECTED_IDEM_IN: Inspected Coal Combustion Waste Impoundments in Indiana (Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Polygon Shapefile, 1:5,000)

pubinfo.publish: Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Office of Land Quality

citeinfo.othercit: This data set was provided to personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) by Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Office of Land Quality personnel on November 13, 2015. The data set provided was in an Esri personal geodatabase format, and was named "Coal_Combustion_Waste_20151113.MDB" that contained a polygon feature class named "INSPECTED_CCW_IMPOUNDMENTS."

descript.abstract:
COAL_COMBUSTION_WASTE_IMPOUNDMENTS_INSPECTED_IDEM_IN.SHP is a polygon shapefile that contains coal combustion waste impoundmentes (CCW) in Indiana that have been inspected by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (US EPA), provided by personnel of Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Office of Land Quality (IDEM, OLQ) as of November 13, 2015. The data set provided by IDEM was in an Esri personal database format and was named "Coal_Combustion_Waste_20151113.MDB" that contained a polygon feature class named "INSPECTED_CCW_IMPOUNDMENTS." COAL_COMBUSTION_WASTE_IMPOUNDMENTS_INSPECTED_IDEM_IN.SHP is attributed with observations by IDEM staff and information found in US EPA contracted reports about the structural integrety and hazard potential some of the impoundment dams.
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDEM, OLQ for the source feature class INSPECTED_CCW_IMPOUNDMENTS:
"CCW impoundments were digitized by IDEM staff from aerial photo-interpretation. This was done in response to the CCW impoundment failure at the TVA/Kingston coal burning electric generating facility during December of 2008, and IDEM's recognition of the need to know the precise locations of these waste features, and what impacts similar failures may have on the Indiana landscape. Also in response to this failure, US EPA initiated a nationwide program assessing the structural integrety and safety of CCW impoundments. US EPA contracted for inspections of these facilities, and information from the reports of Indiana facilities are included in the IDEM developed attributes of these features. The attributes, information about the features in tabular format, were compiled from information taken from the published reports of impoundment inspections done by US EPA contracted firms, and notes from IDEM field inspections, as well as observations made by IDEM GIS staff as the features were digitally mapped. The qualitative and quatitative attributes provide information of impoundment size, capacity, dike/dam hazard potential, types of waste placed in the impoundment, owner, facility name, impoundment use, and field observations by IDEM inspectors and USEPA contrated specialists.
"The USEPA contracted nation wide reports are found: http://www3.epa.gov/epawaste/nonhaz/industrial/special/fossil/surveys2/index.htm#_ga=1.5580723.182041078.1443707387
"From the EPA reports: 'A CCW management unit is defined as a surface impoundment or similar diked or bermed management unit or management units designated as landfills that receive liquidborne material and are used for the storage or disposal of residuals or by-products from the combustion of coal, including, but not limited to, fly ash, bottom ash, boiler slag, or flu gas emission control residuals. Management units also include inactive impoundments that have not been formally closed in compliance with applicable federal or state closure/reclamation regulations.'"
descript.purpose:
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDEM, OLQ for the source feature class INSPECTED_CCW_IMPOUNDMENTS:
"These data were developed to provide the spatial context for Coal Combustion Waste (CCW) (also referred to as Coal Combustion Residuals (CCR)) impoundments located in Indiana. CCW impoundments are areas used for emplacement of liquid borne waste material resulting from the burning of coal for the production of electricity. The map feature's attributes include observations by IDEM staff and information found in US EPA contracted reports about the structural integrety and hazard potential some of the impoundment dams. This data set was developed by digitizing areas interpreted to be CCW impoundments from aerial photo interpretation, therefore some of these feature have not been verified by direct field observation. CCW/CCR impoundments that have been field verified are also included in these data, as is information from those inspected impoundments reports."

theme.themekey: Coal Burning Public Electric Generating Facility

attracc.attraccr:
This data set was provided by IDEM personnel and is assumed to be accurate.
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDEM, OLQ for the source feature class INSPECTED_CCW_IMPOUNDMENTS:
"The attributes, information about the features in tabular format, were compiled from information taken from the published reports of impoundment inspections done by EPA contracted firms, and notes from IDEM field inspections, as well as observations made by IDEM GIS staff as the features were digitally mapped. The qualitative and quatitative attributes provide information of impoundment size, capacity, dike/dam hazard potential, types of waste placed in the impoundment, owner, facility name, impoundment use, and field observations by IDEM inspectors and USEPA contrated specialists."

dataqual.logic: This data set was provided by IDEM personnel and is assumed to be accurate.
dataqual.complete:
This data set was provided by IDEM personnel and is assumed to be complete.
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by IDEM, OLQ for the source feature class INSPECTED_CCW_IMPOUNDMENTS:
"Many facilities have other impoundment units which are not included in the US EPA inspection reports either because coal waste is not stored there, was previously stored there and has been removed, or the units were not in use at the time of the US EPA inspection."

citeinfo.origin: IDEM Office of Land Quality; Kevin Miller
citeinfo.title: Coal_Combustion_Waste_20151113.MDB (Containing polygon feature class named INSPECTED_CCW_IMPOUNDMENTS)

srctime.srccurr: Based on metadata provided by IDEM, OLQ for the source feature class named "INSPECTED_CCW_IMPOUNDMENTS"

srcinfo.srccontr: Inspected coal combustion waste impoundment boundaries in Indiana, current as of November 13, 2015.

procstep.procdesc: IGS personnel received an Esri personal geodatabase named "Coal_Combustion_Waste_20151113.MDB" from IDEM personnel on January 29, 2014, which contained the polygon feature class named "INSPECTED_CCW_IMPOUNDMENTS". INSPECTED_CCW_IMPOUNDMENTS was loaded into Esri ArcMap 10.3 and the shapefile was visually checked to ensure that all data provided are contained within the state of Indiana. IGS personnel then exported the layer as an Esri shapefile named COAL_COMBUSTION_WASTE_IMPOUNDMENTS_INSPECTED_IDEM_IN.SHP. The attribute fields named "State_ID " and "Permit_Number" were deleted from the atttribute table because they contained no data. It should also be noted that portions of the associated metadata provided by IDEM for the source feature class named "INSPECTED_CCW_IMPOUNDMENTS" were extracted and included in this metadata file.
procstep.srcused: Coal_Combustion_Waste_20151113.MDB (Containing polygon feature class named INSPECTED_CCW_IMPOUNDMENTS)

procstep.procdesc: This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number
attr.attrdefs: ESRI

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are software generated

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry
attr.attrdefs: ESRI

attrdomv.udom: Feature type defining the point features

attr.attrdef: The county where the impoundment is located
attr.attrdefs: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

attr.attrdef: The entity which owns and is responsible for the property (impoundment) shown
attr.attrdefs: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

attr.attrdef: The name of the electric generating station where the map feature (impoundment) is located
attr.attrdefs: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

attr.attrdef: The name given to the map feature (impoundment) shown as reported by the property owner
attr.attrdefs: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

attr.attrdef: The measured area as reported by the software (Esri ArcMap 10.1) in US acres. In many instances, this software calculated acreage differs from the acreage reported in the USEPA contracted report.
attr.attrdefs: Esri

attr.attrdef: Noted by GIS staff. If shown as "REPORTED" the information is from the EPA impoundment report. Other entries are observations by GIS staff made while digitizing the impoundments.
attr.attrdefs: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

attr.attrdef: Information given by facilty personel to IDEM staff during field inspections
attr.attrdefs: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

attr.attrdef: "Yes" / "No" values if the impoundments were included in the USEPA report. Many facilities have other impoundment units which are not included in the USEPA inspection reports either because coal waste is not stored there, was previously stored there and has been removed, or the units were not in use at the time of the USEPA inspection.
attr.attrdefs: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

attr.attrdef: Storage capacity for the unit as reported in the USEPA contracted inspection reports. Storage capacity was described as cubic yards or acre feet in the reports. IDEM GIS staff converted cubic yard values to acre feet, and entered acre feet values in the feature table.
attr.attrdefs: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

attr.attrdef: The publication date noted on the US EPA contracted impoundment inspection report
attr.attrdefs: US EPA

attr.attrdef: As noted in US EPA contracted inspection documents, Reported as "TRUE" if fly ash waste material is stored in the unit, "FALSE" if fly ash material is not stored in the unit.
attr.attrdefs: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

attr.attrdef: As noted in US EPA contracted inspection documents, Reported as "TRUE" if bottom ash waste material is stored in the unit, "FALSE" if bottom ash waste material is not stored in the unit.
attr.attrdefs: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

attr.attrdef: As noted in US EPA contracted inspection documents, Reported as "TRUE" if boiler slag waste material is stored in the unit, "FALSE" if boiler slag waste material is not stored in the unit.
attr.attrdefs: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

attr.attrdef: As noted in US EPA contracted inspection documents, Reported as "TRUE" if flu gas desulpherization waste material is stored in the unit, "FALSE" if flu gas desulpherization waste material is not stored in the unit.
attr.attrdefs: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

attr.attrdef: As noted in US EPA contracted inspection documents, lists any other residual waste materials are stored in the unit.
attr.attrdefs: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

attr.attrdef: The hazard potential for dam failure. From Federal Guidlines for Dam Safety, the Hazard Potential Classification System for Dams is based on the probable loss of human life and the potential for economic losses, environmental damage, and/or disruption to lifelines caused by failure of mis-operation of a dam or its appurtenances. LESS THAN LOW HAZARD POTENTIAL: Failure or misoperation of the dam results in no probable loss of human life or economic or environmental losses. LOW HAZARD POTENTIAL: Dams where failure or misoperation results in no probable loss of human life or economic or environmental losses. Losses are principally limited to the owner's property. SIGNIFICANT HAZARD POTENTIAL: Dams where failure or misoperation results in no probable loss of human life but can cause economic loss, environmental damage, disruption of lifeline facilities, or can impact other concerns. Dams are often located in predominatley rural or agricultural areas, but couild be located in areas with population and significant infrastructure. HIGH HAZARD POTENTIAL: Dams where failure or misoperation will probably cause loss of human life.
attr.attrdefs: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

edom.edomvd: Dams where failure or misoperation will probably cause loss of human life.
edom.edomvds: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

edom.edomvd: Dams where failure or misoperation results in no probable loss of human life but can cause economic loss, environmental damage, disruption of lifeline facilities, or can impact other concerns. Dams are often located in predominatley rural or agricultural areas, but couild be located in areas with population and significant infrastructure.
edom.edomvds: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

edom.edomvd: Dams where failure or misoperation will probably cause loss of human life.
edom.edomvds: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

edom.edomvd: Failure or misoperation of the dam results in no probable loss of human life or economic or environmental losses
edom.edomvds: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

edom.edomvd: Sites that have dams that have not had a qualitative accessment of rated risks associated with dam failure or misoperation
edom.edomvds: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

edom.edomvd: Sites that have dams that have not had a qualitative accessment of rated risks associated with dam failure or misoperation
edom.edomvds: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

edom.edomvd: Sites that have dams that have not had a qualitative accessment of rated risks associated with dam failure or misoperation
edom.edomvds: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

attr.attrdef: The federal and state National Pollutant Discharge System (NPDES) permit number. If present, the number assigned by the state and federal government for the discharge outfall associated with the impoundment(s). These numbers can be used to query state and federal databases to find what pollutant levels are allowed in waters passing out of the pipe and into the environment. If not present, there is no NPDES permitted outfall associated with the impoundment(s).
attr.attrdefs: Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management

attr.attrdef: The lowest elevation (in feet above sea level) found on the crest of the impoundment dam, and as reported in the US EPA contracted inspection report (some "null" values are present in the data table).
attr.attrdefs: US EPA

attr.attrdef: Area of the impoundment (software computed)
attr.attrdefs: Esri

attr.attrdef: Length of the perimeter of the impoundment (software computed)
attr.attrdefs: Esri

distinfo.distliab:
CREDIT
It is requested that the Office of Land Quality, Indiana Department of Environmental Management be cited in any products generated from this data. The following source citation should be included: [COAL_COMBUSTION_WASTE_IMPOUNDMENTS_INSPECTED_IDEM_IN: Inspected Coal Combustion Waste Impoundments in Indiana (Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Polygon Shapefile, 1:5,000), 2015113].
WARRANTY
Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey warrants that the media on which this product is stored will be free from defect in materials and workmanship for ninety (90) days from the date of acquisition. If such a defect is found, return the media to Publication Sales, Indiana Geological Survey, 611 North Walnut Grove, Bloomington, Indiana 47405-2208, and it will be replaced free of charge.
LIMITATION OF WARRANTIES AND LIABILITY
Except for the expressed warranty above, the product is provided "AS IS", without any other warranties or conditions, expressed or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties for product quality, or suitability to a particular purpose or use. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
